Hey, on the topic of China's over-expansion. Their 'reclamation' of land that aren't even theirs to begin with is causing major damage to the natural coral reefs. Also, they drive away fishermen who were fishing there their entire lives and at times take their catch.

So any chance the UN is going to do anything about this? Since our President is too much of an idiot.

topics.body:
"@Albus Fahrenheits":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/555d486f636872026a9d3600#post_555d486f636872026a9d3600
Probably no, but keep in mind the problem with mainland China is probably going to sort itself out in a decade or so.

Reason why mainland China in the long run is fucked:
They only got so powerful cause of their factories -> factories are being automated -> the usa and other countries no longer need china to manufacture their products -> RIP mainland china's economy in the long run.

Mainland China's economy is already starting to slow down cause they have nothing else to fall back on economically.

"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/555d48ce636872026a4f3700#post_555d48ce636872026a4f3700
[bq="trashboat"]I'm just confused at how it became so popular. It just sounds boring to me.[/bq]
Short version:
Monster girls are about as popular as say bronies or such.
There is no mainstream anime that the central premise is about monster girls.
Therefore if someone came along and pandered to them it would be successful.

Hypothetically speaking let's say action shonen was in *ANY* mainstream anime *EVER*; it *NEVER* existed in the mainstream -> then comes along one punch man.  What do you think would happen?

Most fans of monster musume will admit that it's not 10/10, but their reaction to the anime is "oh thank god someone is paying attention to us fans for once!"  Very few people are saying it's going to be "the greatest anime ever! (tm)" rather people are going, "oh thank god the anime industry is paying attention to us finally!"
